title: How confident are you about about TSM and Fnatic?
body: I like both TSM and Fnatic, but I watched SKT vs GET and SKT vs CJ and I am worried. Without Faker or Bengi SKT 3-0 GET.

replies.body:
I've said it for months, IEM Katowice was a chance of bracket and circumstance. MSI/Worlds this year will be (once again) Korea vs China. Fnatic and TSM will be competing for 3rd.

The current state of the teams I put TSM over Fnatic. That is clearly because of the performance Fnatic have shown versus what TSM has shown. I am no TSM Fanboy, which you can see pretty much on the forums, but they have the ability to survive Fnatic's early aggression and Bjerg can just dominate Feb.

At least they opened the prize pool to include 3rd and 4th place spots so NA/EU can get in on the moneys.
hopeful for fanatic, could give a fuck less about tsm...and Im NA. Will say I empathize with Dyrus tho....his team clearly doesnt give a fuck about him...prove me wrong

> [{quoted}](name=Ganiklis,realm=NA,application-id=9hBQwnEU,discussion-id=abgAvnmA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2015-05-04T03:50:19.012+0000)
>
> hopeful for fanatic, could give a fuck less about tsm...and Im NA. Will say I empathize with Dyrus tho....his team clearly doesnt give a fuck about him...prove me wrong

I understand why you are saying this- and Dyrus himself has expressed similar sentiments. But I think it's a little more complicated than that. League is a team game and TSM "asks" Dyrus to sacrifice for the team.

Dyrus is not a carry top so he is asked to "do the best he can" with whatever they need for team comp (eg Lulu) so that Bjerg can carry, Turtle can clean up and Santorin can help Bjerg and Turtle do their things. This means that Dyrus is often left on an island to die 1v4 so that the team can win. And it works.
